channel.title: MVP for Java
channel.description:
Hi,
A while ago I started on a little project to make my Swing user interfaces a little cleaner. As a result I started working on a library that offers (fairly) easy use of the MVP design pattern for Swing. I'm hoping to expand it to something more with useful features and an accompanying widget library that abstracts some of the filthy stuff in Swing.
I created a SVN repository on google code where I will be putting the changes into and I figured I might aswell post it here because it may be useful for someone. It's really rough right now but here goes; You can find the project at http://code.google.com/p/auroralibs-mvp/
Please post any suggestions or "weird things" you might see around, I do want to improve it as much as I can but i'm pretty sure i'll be missing some things from time to time.

item.title: MVP for Java
item.dc:creator: @_Rick1 _Rick
item.description:
@_Rick1 wrote:

Hi,

A while ago I started on a little project to make my Swing user interfaces a little cleaner.
As a result I started working on a library that offers (fairly) easy use of the MVP design pattern for Swing.
I’m hoping to expand it to something more with useful features and an accompanying widget library that abstracts some of the filthy stuff in Swing.

I created a SVN repository on google code where I will be putting the changes into and I figured I might aswell post it here because it may be useful for someone.
It’s really rough right now but here goes; You can find the project at http://code.google.com/p/auroralibs-mvp/

Please post any suggestions or “weird things” you might see around, I do want to improve it as much as I can but i’m pretty sure i’ll be missing some things from time to time.
